meanings.definition: Of or relating to the administration of justice or the function of a judge.
meanings.sent1: The judicatory process ensures fair decisions are made.
meanings.sent2: The judicatory system plays a crucial role in upholding justice.
meanings.sent3: The judicatory proceedings were so formal, even the chairs seemed serious.
meanings.sent4: Her judicatory approach to problem-solving was like a wise owl overseeing a forest.
meanings.sent5: The judicatory responsibilities weighed heavily on his shoulders.

meanings.definition: A court of law or tribunal.
meanings.sent1: The judicatory convened to hear the case.
meanings.sent2: She visited the judicatory to seek legal advice.
meanings.sent3: The judicatory building looked imposing from the outside.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of justice, the judicatory stood as a beacon of hope.
meanings.sent5: The judicatory echoed with the solemnity of legal proceedings.
